snippet: The compensation included a $2.5 million base salary and long-term stock and stock option awards of $17.3 million.
abstract: Walt Disney Co discloses that it paid chief executive and chairman Robert A Iger $46.5 million overall in fiscal 2014, up 35 percent from $34.3 million in 2013; Iger's compensation is largely tied to company's financial performance.
lead_paragraph: The compensation included a $2.5 million base salary and long-term stock and stock option awards of $17.3 million.

headline.print_headline: Disney’s Chief Was Paid $46.5 Million Last Year
